text: Flos fulgida, the shining plushblue, is a species of lycaenid or blue butterfly found in the Indomalayan realm, including India. The species was first described by William Chapman Hewitson in 1863.Seitz, A., 1912-1927. Die Indo-Australien Tagfalter Grossschmetterlinge Erde 9 ==Subspecies== *F. f. fulgida Sikkim, Assam - Myanmar, Thailand, Laos *F. f. singhapura (Distant, 1885) Peninsular Malaya, Singapore, Sumatra, Java, Borneo *F. f. zilana (Fruhstorfer, 1900) Philippines (Basilan, Mindoro) ==References== Category:Flos Category:Fauna of Pakistan Category:Butterflies of India Category:Butterflies of Singapore
title: Flos fulgida
